result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo S Zwaga was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights restored.  Must supply a DNA sample if one has not been previously submitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo S Zwaga

Defendant Angelo S Zwaga in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant Angelo S Zwaga in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Angelo S Zwaga in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Angelo S Zwaga in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

The State has made a drug court offer  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
PRETRIAL SCREENING REPORT
Preliminary hearing on September 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Angelo S Zwaga in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Angelo S Zwaga in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
